title: The X Factor: Celebrity: Nicole Scherzinger reveals she only likes to be filmed from ONE side
text:
She is making her grand return to The X Factor after two years away from the panel.

And Nicole Scherzinger wanted to ensure everything was perfect for her comeback to The X Factor: Celebrity as she revealed she only likes to be filmed from one side.

The former Pussycat Dolls singer, 41, demanded to sit to the left of fellow returning judge Louis Walsh, 67 so that her 'good side' would face the audience.

Left only: Nicole Scherzinger wanted to ensure everything was perfect for her comeback to The X Factor: Celebrity as she revealed she only likes to be filmed from one side

Force of habit: The former Pussycat Dolls singer, 41, demanded to sit to the left of fellow returning judge Louis Walsh, 67 so that her 'good side' would face the audience (above in 2013)

When asked which seat she would be taking at the press launch on Wednesday, the Don't Hold Your Breath songstress told Dermot O'Leary: 'This side is my good side.'

Nicole was a firm fixture on the X factor panel from 2012-2013 and again from 2016-2017, with Louis judging from 2004-2014, and 2016-2017.

The reality stalwart and Westlife manager couldn't resist taking a dig at his boss and long-time pal Simon Cowell, 60, for sacking him numerous times, only to bring him back for the celebrity version of the hit show.

He said: ‘He’s sacked me two or three times. But I love doing this show, and I love working with Nicole, and with Simon. But it’s like a whole new X Factor, it’s nothing like it was. The show is great fun, and it pays.’

Lol: When asked which seat she would be taking at the press launch on Wednesday, the Don't Hold Your Breath songstress told Dermot O'Leary: 'This side is my good side'

Left side: Nicole was a firm fixture on the X factor panel from 2012-2013 and again from 2016-2017, with Louis judging from 2004-2014, and 2016-2017 (pictured 2017)

Discussing the new format, show host Dermot O'Leary, 46, said:‘We’re kind of off the map with this. Not sure we’ll find a recording artist at the end of it, but we hope so.’

‘Some of Simon’s decisions you can agree with, some – like 2015 – you can’t agree with.’

On who they thought would win the competition, Nicole backed Max and Harvey- identical twin singers from Berkshire who rose to fame on social app musical.ly

She said: ‘I think everybody has a shot at winning right now, but if I had to answer like right now then the person that came to mind right now, then it’d be the twins.

‘Only because of social media and everything, and they’re actually super talented. I’m not gonna play them down: They sounded wicked up there, they brought the energy, they’ve got everything going on.

Knows her angles: Nicole pulled off her signature pose as she arrived at the 2017 auditions

And again: Nicole made sure she sat to the left of Louis in 2013 to show off her best side

‘But everybody, I genuinely feel has their own shot at winning’.

Louis added: ‘I think it’s wide open. I think it’s a popularity contest as well. Martin (Bashir) was a revelation. And everyone’s good.’

When asked if people with a huge online presence have an advantage, Nicole responded: ‘Talent and personality and story and authenticity always shines through. This country knows heart very well, it’s part of the reason I’m here, and people aren’t stupid. People know what they gravitate to, what they feel, what they connect with.’

The celebrity line up is Megan McKenna, 27, The Islanders - made up of Love Island 2018 contestants Wes Nelson, 21, Zara McDermott, 22, Samira Mighty and Eyal Booker, 24, Ricki Lake, 51, Try Star - made up of rugby players Thom Evans, 34, Levi Davis, 21, Ben Foden, 34, Hayley Hasselhoff, 27, The Chase star Jenny Ryan, 37, Cole & Edwards - made up of Strictly star - Brendan Cole, 43 and actor Jeremy Edwards, 48, Glee star Kevin McHale, 31.

Only recently, in an interview ahead of the launch, Simon revealed the reason why he decided to revamp the normal show into a celebrity version.

He is a popstar! The reality stalwart and Westlife manager couldn't resist taking a dig at his boss and long-time pal Simon Cowell, 60, for sacking him numerous times, only to bring him back for the celebrity version of the hit show

'It just felt so obvious to do a celebrity version', he explained. 'The only condition was I couldn’t know who was going to be on it. I said to the team, "You’ve got to find some acts who you believe can sell records off the back of this, because if you don’t do that it won’t work."

'So that was the deal and we stuck to it. I swear to God I didn’t have a clue who any of the acts were. I did walk away thinking, “If we’re smart, we have artists here who could actually sell records off the back of this”. So I thought that was fun and very exciting for the show.'

The music boss also shared how he felt about holding the auditions in his own back garden.

He said: 'When we filmed it that night it didn’t feel like work. I loved every second of it. I said to the producers, “If this really doesn’t work, we will have to re-audition for the show. That’s the deal.”

Guess who's back? He said: ‘He’s sacked me two or three times. But I love doing this show, and I love working with Nicole, and with Simon'

'So the fact that I felt we didn’t need to was just great. I found it interesting and fun, and doing this version of the show has also given me the chance to do All Stars. I’ve wanted to make the best of the best version of The X Factor for a long, long time. It’s been brilliant. I’ve loved every minute.'

Meanwhile, returning judge Louis, 67, revealed why he's so excited about the show, adding that the contestants are not what people will expect.

He said: 'What we’re doing this year I think is a brilliant idea. I think everyone’s going to love watching these celebrities because it’s not what people expect. Some of them are really good.

'The show feels more exciting, there’s no bootcamp, no six chair challenge, it feels slick this year. It’s been the best show on TV for a long time and has just had a little rebranding, I suppose, a new X Factor.'

Reunited: Nicole, Louis and Simon are pictured with Sharon Osbourne and Dermot O'Leary in 2017

While Nicole explained why the celebrity version differs from the civilian edition.

She explained: 'Obviously it’s a lot shorter, which is the difference between The X Factor: Celebrity and the ones in the past. This one doesn’t have boot camp and all that jazz, and I loved that we just cut straight to the chase. I was really excited to see who the celebrities were going to be.'

And the Don't Hold Your Breath hitmaker ensured that she'll be as competitive as ever this year.

'Oh always!' she insisted. 'You can’t take that out of me! I’m just going to be very supportive. This year I think the way Simon has done it is that we help them and support them. In the past when I did it, I was quite hands-on and did a lot. But I’m ready to see what they are going to bring to this show.'

This series, like the civilian version, will see the acts split into three groups; the overs, the unders and the groups.

The X Factor: Celebrity starts Saturday 12th October 8:35pm on ITV.
